title: AC/DC Power Up Tour
articleDescription: The world's greatest rock'n'roll band returns to the MCG on Wednesday 12 and Sunday 16 November
articleContent:
The world's greatest rock'n'roll band returns to Australia for the first time in a decade!

The concert will begin at 8:00pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey. 

Wednesday 12 November

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines arrive prior to the concert:

  • Mernda, Greensborough, Glen Waverley, Sandringham, Craigieburn and Sunbury passengers.

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Epping, Greensborough, MacLeod, Flinders Steet, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Caulfield, Frankston, Sandringham, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury passengers.

East Pakenham & Cranbourne line passengers:

  • Board Caulfield-bound services at Richmond (Platform 6).  
  • Change at Caulfield to the connecting bus to Dandenong.

Werribee line passengers:

  • Board Newport-bound services at Flinders Street.  
  • Change at Newport to the connecting bus.

Staff will be available at stations to assist passengers. 

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG

Route 48

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13 and Collins Street/Victoria Harbour Stop D18

Route 70a

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Flinders Street West Stop 06, and MCG/John Cain Arena stop 7C.

Route 75a

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Flinders Street Stop 04 and Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Wyndham Vale, Ballarat, Melton 

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Wendouree, Ballarat and Bendigo

Additional coaches for the following line depart after the concert:

  • Seymour

Sunday 16 November

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Mernda, Epping, Greensborough, MacLeod, Flinders Steet, Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Cheltenham, Sandringham, Werribee, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury passengers.

Frankston line passengers:

  • Board Cheltenham-bound services at Richmond (Platform 4).  
  • Change at Cheltenham to a connecting bus to Frankston.

Werribee line passengers:

  • Board Newport-bound services at Flinders Street (Platform 9).  
  • Change at Newport to the connecting bus.

Staff will be available at stations to assist passengers. 

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG

Route 48

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13 and Collins Street/Victoria Harbour Stop D18

Route 70a

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Flinders Street West Stop 06, and MCG/John Cain Arena stop 7C.

Route 75a

  • Trams will operate as a shuttle between Flinders Street Stop 04 and Wellington Parade/Simpson Street Stop 13.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

Additional services for the following lines arrive before the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds 

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds, Wendouree, Ballarat & Bendigo 

Return coaches due to rail replacement for the following line depart after the concert:

  • Seymour Line

Additional information

  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google Wallet™ app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.
